Author: sharpshoot
Title: How game mechanics can make your app more fun

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
I don't understand the point of the uncov blog, except as a place for juvenile "haters" (is that expression mainstream yet?) to vent their frustrations.

If a web service is ill-conceived, useless, etc. it will die of its own accord.

I'd be willing to wager, though, that something they lambaste will wind up as a huge success, and they'll look (even more) ridiculous.\n

Author: mattculbreth
Content:
I'd never heard the Reddit price. Still don't know if that's the correct figure of course, but it was interesting to see it.

Also interesting to see some of the other people getting additional funding.

Author: felipe
Content:
No, I wouldn't! Your users are telling you how they want to use your app. Besides, there is nothing more inspiring than having users actually using your software!

See "Let a hundred flowers blossom": http://blog.guykawasaki.com/2006/02/the_art_of_rain.html

The caveat of that concept is if users are using your software on a way that is impossible to capitalize...

Author: sharpshoot
Content:
Is there actually any info there that wasn't already known.

No mention of xobni, hey san or auctomatic: who have all have good news on the funding front. \n
